intro: Viola hideoi var. robustior, commonly known as the Japanese violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy violet-blue flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10-15 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. It prefers partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long blooming period.
